item.title: Erin add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description:
"A writer, I think, is someone who pays attention to the world."
[<i>Speech upon being awarded the Friedenspreis des Deutschen Buchhandels (Peace Prize of the German Book Trade)</i>, Frankfurt Book Fair, October 12, 2003]" -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Erin add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "The history of men's opposition to women's emancipation is more interesting perhaps than the story of that emancipation itself." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Erin add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "Language is courage: the ability to conceive a thought, to speak it, and by doing so to make it true." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Erin add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I am the Lorax. I speak for the trees. I speak for the trees for the trees have no tongues." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Erin add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "If I had a world of my own, everything would be nonsense. Nothing would be what it is, because everything would be what it isn't. And contrary wise, what is, it wouldn't be. And what it wouldn't be, it would. You see?" -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Erin add a quote by William Butler Yeats
item.description: "Education is not the filling of a pail, but the lighting of a fire." -- William Butler Yeats

item.title: Erin add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "Mr Leopold Bloom ate with relish the inner organs of beasts and fowls. He liked thick giblet soup, nutty gizzards, a stuffed roast heart, liverslices fried with crustcrumbs, fried hencods' roes. Most of all he liked grilled mutton kidneys which gave to his palate a fine tang of faintly scented urine." -- James Joyce

item.title: Erin add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "The sea, the snotgreen sea, the scrotumtightening sea." -- James Joyce

item.title: Erin add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Hold fast to the diary from today on! Write regularly! Don't surrender! Even if no salvation should come, I want to be worthy of it every moment." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Erin add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "I thought how unpleasant it is to be locked out; and I thought how it is worse, perhaps, to be locked in." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Erin add a quote by J. M. Coetzee
item.description: "I have never seen anything like it: two little discs of glass suspended in front of his eyes in loops of wire. Is he blind?" -- J. M. Coetzee

item.title: Erin add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
